results.content: Greg is one of the best teachers out on Udemy to learn the foundational knowledge of web technologies and understanding the basics of web development. A perfect place to start for a beginner in IT field or for someone changing their career path.

results.content:
After taking Codeing For Beginners 1, it`s perfect to continue with. Good examples and easy to follow. The only downside I had to experience this time that the alert functions did not work for me. And unfortunately no one in the Q&A section ever answered. So I guess I will never figure out what the problem was :(
But still recommending!

results.content:
If you are a beginner and you want to learn how to create a web page from 0, this course is for you.
You don´t need to take the first course (about python) but it helps to have a little more of context.
Also if you are a fan of Harry Potter you will love the section 7.

results.content: The class fulfilled all of my expectations. As a complete beginner, I appreciated gaining a good foundation to start my journey in learning how to code. Thank you for making web development less scary!
results.content_html: The class fulfilled all of my expectations. As a complete beginner, I appreciated gaining a good foundation to start my journey in learning how to code. Thank you for making web development less scary!

results.content:
This is my second course by Greg/Applause Interactive and it was just as fantastic as the first! For anyone unsure if they should take this course after taking the first one, it's an absolutely great follow up! A lot of the same principles are used and this really helped further my understanding of the core coding concepts immensely. 

Looking forward to whatever comes out next!
results.content_html:

results.content: I gotta say I'm enjoying this course. I'm able to keep up with the teacher and I'm learning new things , which you know I love. This latest bit with the colors was fun and so exciting I actually heard myself WHOOP! out loud, that even surprised me. Fortunately alot of the references he's given us I already knew about, except for Balsamiq. And now there's an interesting piece of work-up tool. I've had a lot of fun with that too. Even found some You-Tube lectures on the uses of it and coded along. Fun little tool. The teacher is very knowledgable of his subject , and delivers it in small enough digestable chunks that the student isn't over whelmed,  yet curious enough to want to learn more. Yes I can say I'm definetly getting alot of bang for my bucks. Totally worth taking this course. Fun and exciting. Which is what coding should be. Still very happy with this course, but now getting ready to start taking the tough stuff. Able to mimic a lovely home page for the code club and quite happy with it. So far so good.

results.content: I love the way you explain things and comment on potential things one might be wondering about - such as if you need to take part 1. I took part 1 six months ago and was wondering if I needed to brush up, but since it's only a recommendation to take it, I think I'm covered - now that I took it although it's six months ago. In general, I just really like your courses.
